div.p: From Eliza Bromby to James McCulloch
L65/5182, unit 209, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 20.8.93. To proof.
Enclosed with letter:
(1) from Adelaide: 'Copy/ Telegram for the President of the Leichhardt Search Committee | I have much pleasure to inform you in answer to your telegram that this Government recommends Parliament to vote five hundred (£500) pounds in aid of expedition in search of Leichhardt. Please send me by first steamer full particulars about the expedition and any printed papers you have in relation thereto also what sum Queensland New South Wales and Victoria respectively will give towards the fund — | Commissioner Public Works'.
(2) from Brisbane: 'June 3 1865 | [...] for Mrs Bromby | Leichhardt Search Committee | The Queensland Govt will recommend to Parliament a vote for the Leichhardt search — I will form a ladies committee to receive contributions | Lady Bowen'.
McCulloch initialled the file containing the above papers on 14 June 1865. Honorable the Chief Secretary

I have the honor to forward copies of Telegrams recently received from Adelaide and Queensland by the Leichhardt Search Committee. The prompt and liberal response of the Governments of those colonies to our appeal encourages me to hope that the Victorian Government will be induced at an early period to bring before the Legislative Assembly the question of the grant in aid of the Leichhardt Search Fund, which you Sir intimated your willingness to propose. We are anxious to make all necessary arrangements without delay that we may not lose the most favorable season for starting the expedition
I have the honor to remain
